comment: This class was pretty hard only because the professor went off of power points and made us pretty much fill in the blanks in class. She did provide practice problems, however, they were not anything like the ones on the test. ALSO there are 4 tests, that is it, so study really good because there is no extra credit and she does not budge on anything

She grades her class based off of 4 tests, but she has videos explaining the content which help. She has practice problems that are very similar to the tests. She got back to me quickly if I asked her any questions. She has a slight accent, but I was still able to understand her. She is a very nice person and very easy to work with.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Only graded on 4 tests the whole semester. Her videos on content are well explained and easy to follow as well as in person lectures. She releases practice problems and exercises to do before the test (optional). Study the content and youll be fine

The content was a little hard, but the professor explains it well. The lectures review her powerpoints she posts and she expects you to take notes before class and bring questions to discuss during class. She responds quickly to emails. Her grading system allows you to do well so just practice her problems she gives and participate in class.

there are only 4 tests and if you take notes and watch the videos, they only help a little on the test. the tests were hard and they were only about 25 questions on each test. this class is hard. i basically had to teach myself this course. i got lucky with ending the class with a B. i would try find someone else if i were you!

The powerpoints are very detailed and so are the tests. The tests look nothing like the things we learned in class. Theyre ten times harder. I learned nothing from this coarse but how to teach myself a whole semester of Econ.

The tests are so much more difficult than the powerpoints and watching her YouTube videos do not help. I had to watch multiple others to even somewhat understand how to do the problems. The class became way more difficult after people were caught cheating and the good students like me were punished for it.

I would recommend taking another professor if you're not familiar with Econ. She literally just reads off the PowerPoint. It sounds like she's reading out of a textbook or expects us to understand what she's saying. I did not enjoy this class. Side note: Don't bother making a group me because of cheaters... This class became 10x worse.

As someone with a disability, this class was so difficult that I had to drop the course. The test are extremely difficult, and there are no other assignments to balance them out. You only have two class periods to learn both units, between each test. The online and class lectures barely match the online practices. It overall was very difficult.
you have 4 tests and thats it ,so you have to do well on them. She does curve your test but the tests are hard. Make sure you watch her videos and STUDYYYY days before the test.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Easiest class I've taken, if you show up and learn you'll get an A. I think it's fantastic that there isn't any homework or pointless assignments. Additionally, the tests closely resemble the material studied in class and the grading policy is extremely generous. If you do struggle with the course, just ask the professor for help.

If you are an amazing test taker, this is the class for you. There are no assignments or extra credit to help balance your grade out which seems like fun until you flunk any of the 4 tests. Lectures are online so you can miss a class or two. Other than that, she's pretty nice and does grade curves. She has a bit of an accent but you get used to it.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: we only had 4 grades that were put in the grade book which were all tests. but the tests were not difficult at all and she lets you use notes while testing. if youre not good at econ, i highly recommend you to watch her youtube videos DAYS prior to test so you can ask her questions. she also responds to emails very fast and his happy to help.

Good Luck with this class. I took it online and relied on her youtube videos to teach me which wasnt good for me. She taught the math part as if we knew where she was pulling her numbers from and stuff like that. She just wasnt clear at all. She does curve exam grades thankfully.

The only thing in the grade-book were 4 test grades, nothing else. Professor Merkel posted her lectures on youtube and the ppt. to D2L. The lectures were easy to understand and each chapter would take less than an hour to do. The best thing was, we were allowed to use our notes on our tests. Amazing professor, I would recommend taking her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: This is the easiest A you can get at the college level. SO much extra credit handed out and only 4 tests the whole semester. You mainly teach yourself from the PowerPoint slides but it is not difficult and the tests are open notes. Also, Professor Merkel is the sweetest lady and always happy to explain when you do not understand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took her for an asynchronous class and I hated it. If it weren't' for my AP Econ background, I wouldn't have been as successful. All she does is read off the notes. She gives NO EXPLANATIONS in her videos. On one test, people did so bad she had to curve it 20 points to get the average to a B. It's an easy A if you can learn the concepts yourself

Very easy online class, though I did have some background knowledge from HS. Her lectures were simple, and the curves and weighting on the tests made it very hard to not get an A. My final grade ended up being way over 100%. Definitely don't buy the textbook, it's not necessary. Take her!

Professor Merkel is so nice! I loved having her as a teacher, even in an online class she was really good about communicating with us and making sure we were understanding the material. Grades are based on four tests, the highest counts as 40%, 2nd highest is 30%, 3rd highest is 20%, and last is 10%. She also will curve tests!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: 4 tests, no other extra work or final. Provides Youtube videos explaining each module and posts it on D2L. Curves tests which is amazing! Definitely study the math sections in each module bc it can be difficult on tests. There's a textbook, but I don't find it necessary. I recommend her!

Professor Merkel is very simple. We have 4 tests, no hw, no final. She uses grade curves so you'll do fine. Watch her lectures to understand the math or else It's a bit difficult, unless you're good with math. No lockdown browser. Asynchronous.

Your total grade is dependent upon 4 tests, but don't worry because she grades on a curve. Definitely wish more of my Ged Ed classes were with professors like her. Lectures are to the point and cover everything you need to know for the test, but she is available if you have further questions or concerns.
The class i took was online and asynchronous. It was easy.

Professor Allie is a great teacher, she made economics easy to understand, with practical examples. Her class was based on a class presentation, you will understand a lot just by reading it but she will explain everything in detail in class. She uses a grade curve which was really helpful, 4 tests, no hw, problem set with questions similar to test
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria
